      • alignSequences

        public long[][] alignSequences(long[] A_withGaps,
                               long[] B_withGaps,
                               boolean returnAlignment,
                               MesquiteNumber score)
        This method returns a 2d-long array ([site][taxon]) representing the alignment of the passed sequences. If object has been told to retain gaps, gaps in A_withGaps will remain intact (new ones may be added)

      • setGapCosts

        public void setGapCosts(int gapOpen,
                        int gapExtend)
        If object wasn't called with gap cost arguments, this must be called or alignment will fail

      • setGapCosts

                        int gapExtend,
                        int gapOpenTerminal,
                        int gapExtendTerminal)
        If object wasn't called with gap cost arguments, this must be called or alignment will fail

        public void setSubsCostMatrix(int[][] subs)

        public boolean getHigherIsBetter()
        This method returns true if better alignment scores are higher. Override if needed.

      • getScoreOfIdenticalSequences

        public MesquiteNumber getScoreOfIdenticalSequences(long[] sequence)
        This method returns the score of two identical copies of the passed sequence. Override if needed.

      • getVeryBadScore

        public MesquiteNumber getVeryBadScore(long[] sequence,
                                      int oppositeLength,
                                      int alphabetLength)
        This method returns the score of the worst possible match with the passed sequence. Acceptable if result is approximate. Override if needed.

      • getAlignment

        public long[][] getAlignment(MolecularData data1,

      • alignSequences

        public long[][] alignSequences(MCategoricalDistribution data,
                               int taxon1,
                               int taxon2,
                               int firstSite,
                               int lastSite,
                               boolean returnAlignment,
                               MesquiteNumber score)
        This method returns a 2d-long array ([site][taxon]) representing the alignment of the sequences identified by the "taxon" and "site" arguments. If object has been told to retain gaps, gaps in taxon1 will remain intact (new ones may be added)

      • alignSequences

        public long[][] alignSequences(MCategoricalDistribution data,
                               int taxon1,
                               int firstSite1,
                               int lastSite1,
                               int taxon2,
                               int firstSite2,
                               int lastSite2,
                               boolean returnAlignment,
                               MesquiteNumber score)
        This method returns a 2d-long array ([site][taxon]) representing the alignment of the sequences identified by the "taxon" and "site" arguments. If object has been told to retain gaps, gaps in taxon1 will remain intact (new ones may be added)
